eForms.BT-04_tooltip: The European Public Procurement Procedure Identifier, a unique identifier of a procurement procedure. Including this identifier in all published versions of this notice (e.g. published on TED, national publication portals, regional publication portals) allows unique identification of procurement procedures around the Union.
eForms.BT-701_tooltip: The European Public Procurement Notice Identifier of this notice. Including this identifier in all published version of this notice (e.g. TED, national publication portals, regional publication portals) allows unique identification of procurement notices around the Union.
eForms.BT-757_tooltip: The version of the notice. This helps, for example, to keep track of versions of notices or changes to notices before publication.
eForms.BT-01_tooltip: The legal basis (e.g. a Union or national legal act) under which the procurement procedure takes place or, in case of prior information notices, under which the procurement procedure(s) will take place.
eForms.BT-03_tooltip: The type of form according to procurement legislation.
eForms.BT-02_tooltip: The type of notice according to procurement legislation.
eForms.BT-803_tooltip: The date and time the notice was transmitted electronically by the eSender to the Publications Office of the European Union
eForms.BT-738_tooltip: The preferred date of publication of the notice on TED (e.g. to avoid publication during a national holiday).
eForms.BT-702_tooltip: The language(s) in which this notice is officially available. These linguistic versions are equally legally valid.
eForms.BT-125_tooltip: In this field you can enter the TED number of the previous prior information notice, whether it is an old form notice (published before the eForms reform) or a new eForms notice. The TED number 2020/S 248-123456 will be automatically converted to the correct format of 123456-2020.
eForms.BT-1251_tooltip: The identifier of a part of a prior information notice or another similar notice related to this notice.
eForms.BT-13720_tooltip: An identifier of one or more sections within this notice. The information in the organisation section refers to this section or these sections.
eForms.BT-500_tooltip: The official name of the organisation.
eForms.BT-501_tooltip: An identifier of the organisation (such as VAT-number). All of the organisation's identifiers shall be given.
eForms.BT-16_tooltip: The name of a part of an organisation (e.g. the relevant department of a large buyer).
eForms.BT-510_tooltip: The name of the street, road, avenue, etc., of the organisation's physical address and further identification (e.g. building number).
eForms.BT-513_tooltip: The name of the locality (city, town, or village) of the organisation's physical address.
eForms.BT-512_tooltip: The post code of the organisation's physical address.
eForms.BT-507_tooltip: The location according to the common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS) of the organisation's physical address. The NUTS3 classification code shall be used.
eForms.BT-514_tooltip: The country of the organisation's physical address.
eForms.BT-502_tooltip: The name of the department or other contact point for communicating with the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the contact point shall allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of European Parliament and Council Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and European Parliament and Council Regulation (EU) 2018/1725).
eForms.BT-506_tooltip: The email address for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the email address shall allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and Regulation (EU) 2018/1725).
eForms.BT-503_tooltip: The telephone number for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the telephone number shall allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and Regulation (EU) 2018/1725).
eForms.BT-739_tooltip: The fax number for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the fax number shall allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and Regulation (EU) 2018/1725).
eForms.BT-509_tooltip: The organisation's uniform resource locator for exchange of data and documents.
eForms.BT-633_tooltip: The organisation is a natural person.
eForms.BT-08_tooltip: The role of the organisation in the procurement procedure (e.g. buyer, winner). A notice shall contain all organisations in the procedure that have the role of a buyer, a winner, a review body, a buyer acquiring supplies and/or services intended for other buyers, a buyer awarding public contracts or concluding framework agreements for works, supplies or services intended for other buyers.
eForms.BT-770_tooltip: The sub-role of the organisation in the procurement procedure (e.g. group leader, organisation providing additional information about the procurement procedure).
eForms.BT-508_tooltip: The website where the buyer publishes information regarding procurement procedures (e.g. notices, procurement documents).
eForms.BT-11_tooltip: The type of buyer according to procurement legislation (e.g. central government authority, body governed by public law, public undertaking).
eForms.BT-740_tooltip: The buyer is a contracting entity.
eForms.BT-10_tooltip: The main activity of the contracting authority.
eForms.BT-610_tooltip: The main activity of the contracting entity.
eForms.BT-165_tooltip: The size of the winner, tenderer or subcontractor (e.g. micro enterprise, small enterprise, medium enterprise).
eForms.BT-706_tooltip: The nationality (or nationalities) of the beneficiary owner(s) of the winner, tenderer, or subcontractor as published in the register(s) established by European Parliament and Council Directive (EU) 2018/843. If such a register does not exist (e.g. in case of contractors established outside the Union) then equivalent information from other sources.
eForms.BT-746_tooltip: The nationality (or nationalities) of the beneficiary owner(s) of the winner, tenderer, or subcontractor is not published in the register(s) established by Directive (EU) 2018/843, because the winner is listed on a regulated market (e.g. a stock exchange) that ensures adequate transparency in line with anti-money laundering legislation.
eForms.BT-22_tooltip: The internal identifier used for files regarding the procurement procedure or lot before a procedure identifier is given (e.g. coming from the buyer's document management system or procurement planning system).
eForms.BT-23_tooltip: The main nature (e.g. works) of what is being bought. In case of mixed procurement (e.g. a procedure for both works and services), the main nature may be, for example, the one with the highest estimated value. This information shall be given for the whole procedure.
eForms.BT-531_tooltip: The nature (e.g. services) of what is being bought, additional to Main Nature.
eForms.BT-24_tooltip: The description of the nature and quantity of what is being bought or of the needs and requirements that shall be met in this procedure. In case of a modification notice, the description of the procurement before and after the modification.
eForms.BT-27_tooltip: The estimated value of the procurement procedure or lot, over its whole duration, including options and renewals.
eForms.BT-557_official: Group Framework Maximum Value Lot Identifier
eForms.BT-557_tooltip: An identifier of a lot within the procedure that is part of a group of lots whose maximum value is lower than the sum of individual maximum values of all the lots together (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots).
eForms.BT-157_tooltip: The maximum value which may be spent in a framework agreement within a group of lots. This information can be provided when the maximum value of a group of lots is lower than the sum of maximum values of individual lots in this group (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots).  Maximum value means a value covering all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals.
eForms.BT-26_tooltip: The type of classification describing the purchase (e.g. the CPV).
eForms.BT-262_tooltip: The code from the classification that best characterises the purchase.
eForms.BT-263_tooltip: An additional code from the classification that also characterises the purchase.
eForms.BT-625_tooltip: The unit which the good, service, or work comes in, for example hours or kilograms. Where the CPV code is a supply which does not need a further unit (e.g. cars), then no unit needs to be given and quantity is taken to be an amount, e.g. the "number of cars".
eForms.BT-53_tooltip: The buyer reserves the right (not an obligation) for additional purchases from the contractor (while the contract is valid).
eForms.BT-94_tooltip: Procurement whose purpose is likely to also be included in another procedure in the foreseeable future. (For example, a regularly re-tendered municipal service. This does not include awarding multiple contracts within a single qualification system, framework agreement, or a dynamic purchasing system.)
eForms.BT-95_tooltip: Any additional information about recurrence (e.g. estimated timing).
eForms.BT-5101_tooltip: The name of the street, road, avenue, etc., of the place of performance and further identification (e.g. building number).
eForms.BT-5131_tooltip: The name of the locality (city, town, or village) of the place of performance.
eForms.BT-5121_tooltip: The postcode of the place of performance.
eForms.BT-5071_tooltip: The location according to the common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS). The NUTS3 classification code shall be used. Please note that if you limit the search for notices by place of performance in Hilma, only those notices where the place of performance is indicated will be displayed. To ensure that your notice is easy to find, please fill in the place of performance whenever possible.
eForms.BT-5141_tooltip: The country of the place of performance.
eForms.BT-727_tooltip: There are other restrictions on the place of performance (e.g. "anywhere in the European Economic Area", "anywhere in the given country").
eForms.BT-728_tooltip: Additional information about the place of performance.
eForms.BT-536_tooltip: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will start.
eForms.BT-36_tooltip: The (estimated) period from the start to the end of the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system. This shall include any options and renewals.
eForms.BT-537_tooltip: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will finish.
eForms.BT-538_tooltip: Choose whether the contract duration is unknown or unlimited.
eForms.BT-58_tooltip: The maximum number of times the contract can be renewed. By renewing, the buyer reserves the right (i.e. not an obligation) to renew the contract (i.e. extend its duration) without a new procurement procedure. For example, a contract may be valid for one year and the buyer may keep a possibility to renew it (e.g. once, twice) for another three months, if he is content with the services he received.
eForms.BT-57_tooltip: Any other information about the renewal(s).
eForms.BT-60_tooltip: The procurement is at least partially financed by Union funds such as the European Structural and Investment Funds or grants awarded by the Union.
eForms.BT-09_tooltip: The applicable law when buyers from different countries procure together within one procurement procedure.
eForms.BT-105_tooltip: The type of procurement procedure (e.g. according to the types given in the Public Procurement Directives mentioned in the recitals of this Act).
eForms.BT-88_tooltip: The main features of the procedure (e.g. description of the individual stage(s)) and information about where the full rules for the procedure can be found. This information shall be given when the procedure is not one of those mentioned in the procurement Directives. This can be the case for example for concessions, for social and other specific services, and in case of voluntary publication of procurement procedures below the EU procurement thresholds.
eForms.BT-106_tooltip: The time limit for receipt of requests to participate or of tenders in this procedure can be reduced due to a state of urgency.
eForms.BT-1351_tooltip: The justification for using an accelerated procedure.
eForms.BT-136_tooltip: A justification for using a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.
eForms.BT-1252_official: Direct Award Justification Previous Procedure Identifier
eForms.BT-1252: Direct Award Justification Previous Procedure Identifier
eForms.BT-1252_tooltip: An identifier of a previous procedure that justifies the use of a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. justifying a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.
eForms.BT-135_tooltip: The justification for using a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.
eForms.BT-31_tooltip: The maximum number of lots for which one tenderer can submit tenders.
eForms.BT-763_tooltip: The tenderer must submit tenders for all lots.
eForms.BT-33_tooltip: The maximum number of lots for which contract(s) can be awarded to one tenderer.
eForms.BT-330_tooltip: The identifier of a group of lots in the procedure.
eForms.BT-50_tooltip: The minimum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure.
eForms.BT-661_tooltip: There is a maximum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure.
eForms.BT-51_tooltip: The maximum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure.
eForms.BT-52_tooltip: The procedure will take place in successive stages. In each stage, some participants may be eliminated.
eForms.BT-120_tooltip: The buyer reserves the right to award the contract on the basis of the initial tenders without any further negotiations.
eForms.BT-644_tooltip: The value of the prize, if any, for the winner of a design contest, innovation partnership or competitive dialogue
eForms.BT-44_tooltip: The place (e.g. first place, second place) in a design contest, innovation partnership or competitive dialogue that receives the prize.
eForms.BT-41_tooltip: Any service contract following the contest will be awarded to one of the winners of the contest.
eForms.BT-45_tooltip: Further information about follow-up contracts, prizes and payments (for example non-monetary prizes, payments given for participation).
eForms.BT-42_tooltip: The decision of the jury is binding on the buyer.
eForms.BT-46_tooltip: A name of the jury member.
eForms.BT-47_tooltip: A name of an already selected participant. A participant could have been selected already at the time of the publication of the design contest notice because, for example, the information about the participation of a world-renowned architect is intended to promote the contest amongst other potential participants.
eForms.BT-67_tooltip: The brief description of criteria regarding the personal situation of tenderers that may lead to their exclusion. This shall include a list of all such criteria and indicate required information (e.g. self-declaration, documentation). This may also include specific national exclusion grounds.
eForms.BT-747_tooltip: The criteria (or criterion) concern(s), for example, economic and financial standing or technical and professional ability.
eForms.BT-748_tooltip: The criteria (or criterion) of the given type are (is) used, unused, or (in case of prior information notice used as a call for competition or to reduce time limits) the use is not yet known.
eForms.BT-749_tooltip: The name of the selection criteria (or criterion).
eForms.BT-750_tooltip: The brief description of the selection criteria (or criterion), including minimum requirements, required information (e.g. self-declaration, documentation) and how the criteria or criterion will be used to select candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure (if a maximum number of candidates was set).
eForms.BT-40: Selection Criteria Second Stage Invite (if a maximum number of candidates was set)
eForms.BT-40_tooltip: The criteria (or criterion) will (only) be used to select the candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure (if a maximum number of candidates was set).
eForms.BG-72_official: Selection Criteria Second Stage Invite Number
eForms.BT-752_official: Selection Criteria Second Stage Invite Number
eForms.BT-752_tooltip: A number linked to the selection criteria (or criterion).
eForms.BT-7531_official: Selection Criteria Second Stage Invite Number Weight
eForms.BT-7531_tooltip: Whether the number linked to a selection criterion (or selection criteria) is a type of weight (e.g. a percentage).
eForms.BT-7532_official: Selection Criteria Second Stage Invite Number Threshold
eForms.BT-7532_tooltip: Whether the number linked to a selection criterion (or selection criteria) is a type of threshold (e.g. a minimum score, a maximum number of tenders with the highest score passing).
eForms.BT-71_tooltip: Whether participation is reserved for specific organisations (e.g. sheltered workshops, organisations pursuing a public service mission).
eForms.BT-79_tooltip: Whether the names and professional qualifications of the staff assigned to perform the contract must be given.
eForms.BT-78_tooltip: The time limit by which tenderers who do not hold a security clearance may obtain it.
eForms.BT-732_tooltip: Additional information about the security clearance (e.g. which level of security clearance is required, which team members must have it, whether it is necessary already for accessing the procurement documents or only for contract execution).
eForms.BT-736_tooltip: Whether the execution of the contract must be performed in the framework of sheltered employment programmes.
eForms.BT-761_tooltip: A certain legal form must be taken by a group of tenderers that is awarded a contract.
eForms.BT-76_tooltip: The legal form that must be taken by a group of tenderers that is awarded a contract.
eForms.BT-70_tooltip: The main information about the performance of the contract (e.g. intermediary deliverables, compensation for damages, intellectual property rights).
eForms.BT-77_tooltip: The main information about financing and payment and/or reference to any provisions that govern them.
eForms.BT-743_tooltip: Whether the buyer will require, allow or not allow electronic invoices.
eForms.BT-65_tooltip: An obligation to be met by the tenderer concerning subcontracting.
eForms.BT-64_tooltip: The minimum percentage of the contract value that the contractor must subcontract using the competitive procedure described in Title III of European Parliament and Council Directive 2009/81/EC.
eForms.BT-729_tooltip: The maximum percentage of the contract value that the contractor must subcontract using the competitive procedure described in Title III of Directive 2009/81/EC.
eForms.BT-539_tooltip: Whether the criterion concerns the price, the cost, or a non-price non-cost attribute of the tender. (Price is the acquisition price; cost is any other non-price monetary criterion.)
eForms.BT-734_tooltip: The name of the award criterion.
eForms.BT-540_tooltip: The description of the award criterion.
eForms.BT-541_tooltip: A number linked to an award criterion.
eForms.BT-5421_tooltip: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a type of weight (e.g. a percentage).
eForms.BT-5422_tooltip: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a fixed value (e.g. a fixed price, a fixed cost).
eForms.BT-5423_tooltip: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a type of threshold (e.g. a minimum score, a maximum number of tenders with the highest score passing).
eForms.BT-543_tooltip: The mathematical equation or any other description used for complicated weighing of criteria (e.g. non-linear weighing, the analytic hierarchy process) when a weighing cannot be expressed per criterion.
eForms.BT-733_tooltip: The justification for only indicating the award criteria's order of importance, not their weighing.
eForms.BT-765_tooltip: Whether a framework agreement with, without, or with and without the reopening of competition is involved.
eForms.BT-778_tooltip: There is a maximum number of participants in the framework agreement.
eForms.BT-113_tooltip: The maximum number of participants in the framework agreement.
eForms.BT-109_tooltip: The justification for exceptional cases when the duration of framework agreements exceeds the legal limits.
eForms.BT-111_tooltip: Any additional categories of buyers participating in the framework agreement and not mentioned by name (e.g. "all hospitals in the Tuscany region").
eForms.BT-766_tooltip: Whether a dynamic purchasing system is involved and, in case of central purchasing bodies, whether it may be used by buyers not listed in this notice.
eForms.BT-119_tooltip: The dynamic purchasing system is terminated. No further contracts, besides those published in this notice, will be awarded in the dynamic purchasing system. This field can be used even if no contracts are awarded in the contract award notice.
eForms.BT-123_tooltip: The internet address of the electronic auction.
eForms.BT-122_tooltip: Any additional information about the electronic auction.
eForms.BT-632_tooltip: The name of the electronic tool or device used for electronic communication.
eForms.BT-724_tooltip: Electronic communication requires the use of tools and devices that are not generally available.
eForms.BT-124_tooltip: Electronic communication requires the use of tools and devices that are not generally available. The uniform resource locator (e.g. the web address) which gives unrestricted and full direct access to these tools and devices.
eForms.BT-127_tooltip: The estimated date of publication of a contract notice within this procedure.
eForms.BT-631_tooltip: The estimated date of dispatch of the invitations to confirm interest.
eForms.BT-130_tooltip: The estimated date of dispatch of the invitations to submit tenders in two (or more) stage procedures.
eForms.BT-99_tooltip: The description of the time limits for review procedures.
eForms.BT-15_tooltip: The internet address for accessing (the non-restricted part of) the procurement documents. For all notices except prior information notices, the address shall give access that is direct (i.e. the exact webpage with the documents, not a general website), unrestricted (e.g. no registration), full (i.e. the procurement documents are complete) and free of charge and the documents shall be available already at the time of the publication of the notice.
eForms.BT-708_tooltip: The language(s) in which the procurement documents are officially available. These linguistic versions are equally legally valid.
eForms.BT-737_tooltip: The language(s) in which the procurement documents (or their parts) are unofficially available. These linguistic versions are not an official translation, they are provided only for information.
eForms.BT-14_tooltip: The access to certain procurement documents is restricted.
eForms.BT-707_tooltip: The justification for restricting access to certain procurement documents.
eForms.BT-615_tooltip: The internet address with information on accessing the restricted (part of the) procurement documents.
eForms.BT-13_tooltip: The time limit for requesting additional information about the procurement procedure.
eForms.BT-17_tooltip: Whether economic operators are required, allowed, or not allowed to submit tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest electronically.
eForms.BT-19_tooltip: The justification for electronic submission of tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest not being possible.
eForms.BT-745_tooltip: The description of how to submit tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest non-electronically.
eForms.BT-18_tooltip: The internet address for submission of tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest by electronic means. The address shall be as direct as possible (ideally a dedicated address for the electronic submission, not just a general website).
eForms.BT-97_tooltip: A language in which tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest may be submitted.
eForms.BT-764_tooltip: Whether it is required, allowed or not allowed to submit (parts of) tenders as electronic catalogues.
eForms.BT-744_tooltip: Advanced or qualified electronic signature or seal (as defined in European Parliament and Council Regulation (EU) No 910/2014) is required.
eForms.BT-63_tooltip: Whether tenderers are required, allowed, or not allowed to submit tenders which fulfil the buyer's needs differently than as proposed in the procurement documents. Further conditions for submitting variant tenders are in the procurement documents.
eForms.BT-769_tooltip: Tenderers may submit more than one tender (for a given lot).
eForms.BT-630_tooltip: The time limit for receipt of expressions of interest.
eForms.BT-1311_tooltip: The time limit for receipt of requests to participate.
eForms.BT-131_tooltip: The time limit for receipt of tenders.
eForms.BT-98_tooltip: The period, from the tender submission deadline, for which tenders must remain valid.
eForms.BT-75_tooltip: The description of the financial guarantee required from the tenderer when submitting a tender. The guarantee can take the form of, for example, a payment to the buyer or a document from a bank. Typically, the guarantee would be forfeit when a tenderer has won the contract but then refused to sign it.
eForms.BT-651_tooltip: The information about subcontracting that must be indicated in the tender.
eForms.BT-132_tooltip: The date and time for the opening of tenders.
eForms.BT-133_tooltip: The place (e.g. physical address, URL) where the tenders will be opened. If you will open the tenders publicly, inform here additional information about the place and how to participate.
eForms.BT-134_tooltip: Further information about the public opening of tenders. (For example, who may participate in the opening and whether any authorisation is needed.)
eForms.BT-771_tooltip: Whether tenderer-related information can be supplemented even after the submission deadline.
eForms.BT-772_tooltip: Description of the tenderer-related information that can be supplemented even after the submission deadline.
eForms.BT-161_tooltip: The value of all contracts awarded in this notice, including options and renewals.
eForms.BT-118_tooltip: The maximum value which can be spent within the framework agreement(s) announced in this notice over its/their whole duration, in all lots, including options and renewals, as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders. Note! The value must be exactly the sum of the maximum value of all the lots for the notice to be accepted by TED.
eForms.BT-556_official: Group Framework Maximum Value Lot Identifier
eForms.BT-556: Group Framework Maximum Value Lot Identifier
eForms.BT-556_tooltip: An identifier of a lot within the procedure that is part of a group of lots whose maximum value is lower than the sum of maximum values of individual lots (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). These are maximum values as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-156_tooltip: It is the re-calculated maximum value likely to be spent for a group of lots within the procedure. This information can be provided when the maximum value of a group of lots is lower than the sum of values of individual lots (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). The value covers all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals. The value is re-calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-144_tooltip: The reason for not choosing a winner.
eForms.BT-709_tooltip: The maximum value which can be spent within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals, as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-660_tooltip: The value likely to be spent within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals, as re-estimated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-759_tooltip: Number of tenders or requests to participate received. Tenders including variants or multiple tenders submitted (for one lot) by the same tenderer should be counted as one tender.
eForms.BT-760_tooltip: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received shall be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area shall also be given. All tenders shall be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender shall be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
eForms.BT-710_tooltip: Value of the admissible tender with the lowest value. A tender shall be considered admissible where it has been submitted by a tenderer, who has not been excluded and who meets the selection criteria, and when it is in conformity with the technical specifications without being irregular (e.g. received late, having an abnormally low price or cost) or unacceptable or unsuitable. Only tenders for which it has been verified if they are admissible or inadmissible may be taken into account.
eForms.BT-711_tooltip: Value of the admissible tender with the highest value. A tender shall be considered admissible where it has been submitted by a tenderer, who has not been excluded and who meets the selection criteria, and when it is in conformity with the technical specifications without being irregular (e.g. received late, having an abnormally low price or cost) or unacceptable or unsuitable. Only tenders for which it has been verified if they are admissible or inadmissible may be taken into account.
eForms.BT-3201_tooltip: An identifier of a tender. The information in the tender section refers to this tender.
eForms.BT-720_tooltip: The value of the tender or another result, including options and renewals. In case of the modification notice, the value of the modification.
eForms.BT-1711_tooltip: The tender was ranked. (This is not the rank itself, but only whether the ranking took place).
eForms.BT-171_tooltip: The position of the tender (i.e. whether the tender ended up first, second, third, etc.) in a design contest, a framework agreement with multiple winners (e.g. cascades), an innovation partnership, a competitive dialogue, or another procedure.
eForms.BT-162_tooltip: The estimated revenue coming from the users of the concession (e.g. fees and fines).
eForms.BT-160_tooltip: The estimated revenue coming from the buyer who granted the concession (e.g. prizes and payments).

eForms.BT-773_tooltip: Whether at least a part of the contract will be subcontracted.

eForms.BT-553_tooltip: The estimated value of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.
eForms.BT-731_tooltip: The buyer knows at least the estimated percentage of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties compared to the whole contract.
eForms.BT-555_tooltip: The estimated percentage of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties compared to the whole contract.
eForms.BT-554_tooltip: The description of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.

eForms.BT-721_tooltip: The name of the contract or, in case of voluntary-ex ante transparency notices and design contest result notices, of the decision.
eForms.BT-1451_tooltip: The date of the official decision choosing the winning tender.
eForms.BT-145_tooltip: The date when the contract was concluded. Typically, this is the date when the last contractual party signed the contract. However, if no contract is signed, then the date of contract conclusion may correspond to other dates (e.g. the date when the buyer notified the winning tenderer). The date of contract conclusion is always later than the end of the standstill period and the moment when any evidence submitted by the winner has been verified.
eForms.BT-768_tooltip: The contract is awarded within a framework agreement.
eForms.BT-151_tooltip: The uniform resource locator (e.g. the web address) of the contract.
eForms.BT-722_tooltip: The programme of the Union funds used to at least partially finance the contract.
eForms.BT-5011_tooltip: An identifier of the Union programme used to at least partially finance the contract. The most concrete information must be given (e.g. grant agreement number, national identifier, project acronym, contract number)

eForms.BT-775_tooltip: A social objective promoted by the works, supplies or services (e.g. fair working conditions).
eForms.BT-776_tooltip: An indication that innovative works, supplies or services are being bought.
eForms.BT-715_tooltip: The number of all vehicles (regardless of whether clean or not) falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC. eForms.BT-725_tooltip: The number of zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles as defined by and falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC. These vehicles have either been purchased, leased, rented, hired-purchased or their use has been contractually committed to for the provision of a purchased service falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC.
eForms.BT-716_tooltip: The number of clean vehicles as defined by and falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC. These vehicles have either been purchased, leased, rented, hired-purchased, or their use has been contractually committed to for the provision of a purchased service falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC.

eForms.BT-712_tooltip: The number of organisations that requested the buyer to review any of its decisions (e.g. the technical specifications, award decision).

eForms.BT-636_tooltip: The type of irregularity alleged in the review requests.
eForms.BT-726_tooltip: The buyer emphasizes that this procurement is also suitable for small and medium enterprises (SMEs).
eForms.BT-115_tooltip: The procurement is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA).

eForms.BT-634_tooltip: This cancelled or unsuccessful procedure or lot will be relaunched.
eForms.BT-756_tooltip: The prior information notice used as a call for competition (or a specific lot) is terminated. No further contracts, besides those published in this notice, will be awarded following this prior information notice used as a call for competition. This field can be used even if no contracts are awarded in the contract award notice.
eForms.BT-300_tooltip: Any further information not mentioned in other sections of the notice.

Only fields concerning the Result value and groups of fields concerning the Tender and Procedure Lot Result can be unpublished. In the case of the European Parliament and Council Directive 2014/25/EU, the award criteria, the procurement procedure, certain dates and in certain cases information about the nature and quantity of a service can be unpublished as well.
eForms.BT-197_tooltip: The justification for not immediately publishing a field.
eForms.BT-196_tooltip: The justification for not immediately publishing a field and for the choice of a later date at which it can be published.
eForms.BT-198_tooltip: The later date at which the originally unpublished field shall be published.

eForms.BG-708_tooltip: Information about the main location of works in case of works; main place of delivery or performance in case of supplies and services. If the place of performance covers several NUTS 3 areas (e.g. a highway, a national network of job centres), then all relevant codes shall be given. This information may differ per lot. In case of a prior information notice used only for information, this information may differ per part of the notice that may later become a lot or a self-standing procedure.
eForms.BG-36_tooltip: Information about the duration of the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system. This must include any options and renewals. This information may differ per lot. eForms.BG-61_tooltip: Information about  Union funds used to finance the procurement. This information may differ per lot.
eForms.BG-614_tooltip: Information about European Union funds that will be used to finance the procedure. The most concrete information must be given (e.g. about concrete projects, not just operational programmes.)
eForms.BG-330_tooltip: Tenderers may submit tenders not only for individual lots, but also for the groups of lots given here. eForms.BT-1118_tooltip: The approximate value to be spent within the framework agreement(s) announced in this notice over its/their whole duration, in all lots, including options and renewals, as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders. Note! The value must be exactly the sum of the approximate value of all the lots for the notice to be accepted by TED.
eForms.BG-556_tooltip: Information about the maximum value which can be spent, in a framework agreement, within a group of lots. eForms.BG-5561_tooltip: Information about the value likely which can to be spent, in a framework agreement, within a group of lots. These lots form a group whose value likely to be spent is lower than the sum of values likely to be spent of individual lots (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). eForms.BT-1561_tooltip: The value likely to be spent, within a framework agreement, for a group of lots. This information can be provided when the value likely to be spent for a group of lots is lower than the sum of values likely to be spent for individual lots (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). eForms.BT-7220_tooltip: The programme of the Union funds used to at least partially finance the contract.
eForms.BT-5010_tooltip: An identifier of the Union programme used to at least partially finance the contract. The most concrete information must be given (e.g. grant agreement number, national identifier, project acronym, contract number).

eForms.BG-710_tooltip: Additional information, which may differ per lot. In case of a prior information notice used only for information, this information may differ per part of the notice that may later become a lot or a self-standing procedure.

strategicProcurements.instructionsTitle: Read more about the national public procurement strategy
strategicProcurements.instructionsText:
Finland's first joint national public procurement strategy was published in September 2020 as part of the Procurement Finland (Hankinta-Suomi) operational program set up by the Ministry of Finance and managed together with Association of Finnish Muncipalities.

The following data is used for statistical purposes and for monitoring of the implementation of the national public procurement strategy. The data will be displayed in the published notice.

contractInformation.contractingsystem: Framework or dynamic procurement procedure information

sections.answerCount: Information on the Number of Tenders and Requests to Participate
sections.infoApprovedSum: Information about value of approved tenderings
sections.subcontracters: Details of the subcontractors named in the tender

results.guidanceText: On this page, report the result of the procurement, such as the value in euros and any possible information about the direct award.

notice.contractModificationsHelpText: Report changes to the contract on this page.

tender.guidanceText: You have chosen on the "Notice" page that suppliers submit their tenders in Hilma (in this service). On this page, you create a call for tenders which will be attached to your notice. You can also add attachments and links to your call for tenders on the "Attachments and links" page.
tender.instructionTitle: Instructions for making a call for tenders
tender.instructionText:
Specify how you want the tenderers to respond to your call for tenders.

If you wish, you can make your request purely in attachment form using the question type "Request attachment". You can attach your own material on the "Attachments and links" page.

You can also ask tenderers for answers in the form of a form. Select a question type to begin creating your request. You can specify whether the question must be answered. You can also set, for example, numerical limits on the answers. This will ensure that you receive the answers to the questions you want and that the tenderers meet the requirements you have set before submitting the tender. This will help in reducing unintentional mistakes. When requesting answers in the form of a form, you can also ask tenderers to add answers in the form of an attachment.

Please note that the tenderer can add attachments to their response only if you have set a "Request attachment" question.

You can create a new question between the existing questions. Press the "Edit" button above or below the question you want to insert. When you are in edit mode, you will receive a button above and below the question for adding a new question.

Instructions for the different question types can be found in connection with each question type.

links.instructionsTitle: Instructions for the "Attachments and links" page

contracts.title: Contracts
contracts.guidanceText: On this page, you can inform about awarded contracts and contractors.
contracts.instructionsTitle: How to notify about an awarded contract
contracts.instructionsText:
Start by adding a contract by pressing the "Add new contract" button at the bottom of the page.
Fill in the basic information about the contract in the "Contract" section. Please note that each contract must have a unique contract identifier (BT-150).
Fill in the information of the winning tender and its organization under "1. tender".

Finally, press the button "Save and continue". Fill in the necessary information in the "Lot results" page.

The new TED number is entered in the format 12345678-2023. The old TED number is entered in the format 123456-2023 or 2020/S 010-019603 (automatically converted to the other format).

eForms.BT-513_description: The name of the locality (city, town or village) of the organisation's physical address.

eForms.BT-503_description: The telephone number for contacting the organisation. A notice shall contain all organisations in the procedure that have the role of a buyer, a winner, a review body, a buyer acquiring supplies and/or services intended for other buyers, a buyer awarding public contracts or concluding framework agreements for works, supplies or services intended for other buyers.

eForms.BT-11_description: The type of buyer according to procurement legislation (e.g. central government authority, body governed by public law, public undertaking).
eForms.BT-740_description: The buyer is a contracting entity.
eForms.BT-10_description: The main activity of the contracting authority.
eForms.BT-610_description: The main activity of the contracting entity.
eForms.BT-165_description: The size of the winner, tenderer or subcontractor (e.g. micro enterprise, small enterprise, medium enterprise).
eForms.BT-706_description: The nationality (or nationalities) of the beneficiary owner(s) of the winner, tenderer, or subcontractor; as published in the register(s) established by anti-money laundering legislation. If such a register does not exist (e.g. in case of non-EU contractors) then equivalent information from other sources.
eForms.BT-746_description: The nationality (or nationalities) of the beneficiary owner(s) of the winner, tenderer, or subcontractor is not published in the register(s) established by anti-money laundering legislation, because the winner is listed on a regulated market (e.g. a stock exchange) that ensures adequate transparency in line with anti-money laundering legislation.
eForms.BT-22_description: The internal identifier used for files regarding the procurement procedure or lot before a procedure identifier is given (e.g. coming from the buyer's document management system or procurement planning system).
eForms.BT-23_description: The main nature (e.g. works) of what is being bought. In case of mixed procurement (e.g. a procedure for both works and services), the main nature may be, for example, the one with the highest estimated value. This information shall be given for the whole procedure.
eForms.BT-531_description: The nature (e.g. services) of what is being bought, additional to Main Nature.
eForms.BT-21_description: The name of the notice or lot.
eForms.BT-24_description: The description of the nature and quantity of what is being bought or of the needs and requirements that shall be met in this procedure or lot. In case of a modification notice, the description of the procurement before and after the modification.
eForms.BT-27_description: The estimated value of the procurement procedure or lot, over its whole duration, including options and renewals.
eForms.BT-557_description: An identifier of a lot within the procedure that is part of a group of lots whose maximum value is lower than the sum of individual maximum values of all the lots together (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots).
eForms.BT-157_description: The maximum value which may be spent in a framework agreement within a group of lots. This information can be provided when the maximum value of a group of lots is lower than the sum of maximum values of individual lots in this group (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). Maximum value means a value covering all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals.
eForms.BT-26_description: The type of classification describing the purchase (e.g. the CPV).
eForms.BT-262_description: The code from the classification that best characterizes the purchase.
eForms.BT-263_description: An additional code from the classification that also characterises the purchase.
eForms.BT-625_description: The unit which the good, service, or work comes in, for example hours or kilograms. Where CPV code is a supply which does not need a further unit (e.g. cars), then no unit needs to be given and quantity is taken to be a count, e.g. the "number of cars".
eForms.BT-53_description: The buyer reserves the right (not an obligation) for additional purchases from the contractor (while the contract is valid).
eForms.BT-94_description: Procurement whose purpose is likely to also be included in another procedure in the foreseeable future. (For example, a regularly re-tendered municipal service. This does not include awarding multiple contracts within a single qualification system, framework agreement, or a dynamic purchasing system.)
eForms.BT-95_description: Any additional information about recurrence (e.g. estimated timing).
eForms.BT-5101_description: The name of the street, road, avenue, etc., of the place of performance and further identification (e.g. building number).
eForms.BT-5131_description: The name of the locality (city, town or village) of the place of performance.
eForms.BT-5121_description: The postcode of the place of performance.
eForms.BT-5071_description: The location according to the common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS). The NUTS3 classification code shall be used.
eForms.BT-5141_description: The country of the place of performance.
eForms.BT-727_description: There are other restrictions on the place of performance (e.g. "anywhere in the European Economic Area", "anywhere in the given country").
eForms.BT-728_description: Additional information about the place of performance.
eForms.BT-536_description: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will start.
eForms.BT-36_description: The (estimated) period from the start to the end of the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system. This shall include any options and renewals.
eForms.BT-537_description: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will finish.
eForms.BT-538_description: The duration is unknown, unlimited, etc.
eForms.BT-58_description: The maximum number of times the contract can be renewed. By renewing, the buyer reserves the right (i.e. not an obligation) to renew the contract (i.e. extend its duration) without a new procurement procedure. For example, a contract may be valid for one year and the buyer may keep a possibility to renew it (e.g. once, twice) for another three months, if he is content with the services he received.
eForms.BT-57_description: Any other information about the renewal(s).
eForms.BT-60_description: The procurement is at least partially financed by Union funds such as the European Structural and Investment Funds or grants awarded by the Union.
eForms.BT-09_description: The applicable law when buyers from different countries procure together within one procurement procedure.
eForms.BT-105_description: The type of procurement procedure (e.g. according to the types given in Public Procurement Directives mentioned in the recitals of this Act).
eForms.BT-88_description: The main features of the procedure (e.g. description of the individual stage(s)) and information about where the full rules for the procedure can be found. This information shall be given when the procedure is not one of those mentioned in the procurement Directives. This can be the case for example for concessions, for social and other specific services, and in case of voluntary publication of procurement procedures below the EU procurement thresholds.
eForms.BT-106_description: The time limit for receipt of requests to participate or of tenders in this procedure can be reduced due to a state of urgency.
eForms.BT-1351_description: The justification for using an accelerated procedure.
eForms.BT-136_description: A justification for using a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.
eForms.BT-1252_description: An identifier of a previous procedure that justifies the use of a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. justifying a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.
eForms.BT-135_description: The justification for using a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.
eForms.BT-31_description: The maximum number of lots for which one tenderer can submit tenders.
eForms.BT-763_description: The tenderer must submit tenders for all lots.
eForms.BT-33_description: The maximum number of lots for which contract(s) can be awarded to one tenderer.
eForms.BT-330_description: The identifier of a group of lots in the procedure.
eForms.BT-50_description: The minimum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure.
eForms.BT-661_description: There is a maximum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure.
eForms.BT-51_description: The maximum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure.
eForms.BT-52_description: The procedure will take place in successive stages. In each stage, some participants may be eliminated.
eForms.BT-120_description: The buyer reserves the right to award the contract on the basis of the initial tenders without any further negotiations.
eForms.BT-644_description: The value of the prize, if any, for the winner of  a design contest, innovation partnership or competitive dialogue
eForms.BT-44_description: The place (e.g. first place, second place) in a design contest, innovation partnership or competitive dialogue that receives the prize.
eForms.BT-41_description: Any service contract following the contest will be awarded to one of the winners of the contest.
eForms.BT-45_description: Further information about follow-up contracts, prizes and payments (for example non-monetary prizes, payments given for participation).
eForms.BT-42_description: The decision of the jury is binding on the buyer.
eForms.BT-46_description: A name of the jury member.
eForms.BT-47_description: A name of an already selected participant. A participant could have been selected already at the time of the publication of the design contest notice because, for example, the information about the participation of a world renowned architect is intended to promote the contest amongst other potential participants.
eForms.BT-67_description: The brief description of criteria regarding the personal situation of tenderers that may lead to their exclusion. This shall include a list of all such criteria and indicate required information (e.g. self-declaration, documentation). This may also include specific national exclusion grounds.
eForms.BT-747_description: The criteria (or criterion) concern(s), for example, economic and financial standing or technical and professional ability.
eForms.BT-748_description: The criteria (or criterion) of the given type are (is) used, unused, or (in case of prior information notice used as a call for competition or to reduce time limits) the use is not yet known.
eForms.BT-749_description: The name of the selection criteria (or criterion).
eForms.BT-750_description: The brief description of the selection criteria (or criterion), including minimum requirements, required information (e.g. self-declaration, documentation) and how the criteria or criterion will be used to select candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure (if a maximum number of candidates was set).
eForms.BT-40_description: The criteria (or criterion) will (only) be used to select the candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure (if a maximum number of candidates was set).
eForms.BT-752_description: A number linked to the selection criteria (or criterion).
eForms.BT-7531_description: Whether the number linked to a selection criterion (or selection criteria) is a type of weight (e.g. a percentage).
eForms.BT-7532_description: Whether the number linked to a selection criterion (or selection criteria) is a type of threshold (e.g. a minimum score, a maximum number of tenders with the highest score passing).
eForms.BT-71_description: Whether participation is reserved for specific organisations (e.g. sheltered workshops, organisations pursuing a public service mission).
eForms.BT-79_description: Whether the names and professional qualifications of the staff assigned to perform the contract must be given.
eForms.BT-78_description: The time limit by which tenderers who do not hold a security clearance may obtain it.
eForms.BT-732_description: Additional information about the security clearance (e.g. which level of security clearance is required, which team members must have it, whether it is necessary already for accessing the procurement documents or only for contract execution).
eForms.BT-736_description: Whether the execution of the contract must be performed in the framework of sheltered employment programmes.
eForms.BT-761_description: A certain legal form must be taken by a group of tenderers that is awarded a contract.
eForms.BT-76_description: The legal form that must be taken by a group of tenderers that is awarded a contract.
eForms.BT-70_description: The main information about the performance of the contract (e.g. intermediary deliverables, compensation for damages, intellectual property rights).
eForms.BT-77_description: The main information about financing and payment and/or reference to any provisions that govern them.
eForms.BT-743_description: Whether the buyer will require, allow or not allow electronic invoices.
eForms.BT-65_description: An obligation to be met by the tenderer concerning subcontracting.
eForms.BT-64_description: The minimum percentage of the contract value that the contractor must subcontract using the competitive procedure described in Title III of European Parliament and Council Directive 2009/81/EC.
eForms.BT-729_description: The maximum percentage of the contract value that the contractor must subcontract using the competitive procedure described in Title III of Directive 2009/81/EC.
eForms.BT-539_description: Whether the criterion concerns the price, the cost, or a non-price non-cost attribute of the tender. (Price is the acquisition price; cost is any other non-price monetary criterion.)
eForms.BT-734_description: The name of the award criterion.
eForms.BT-540_description: The description of the award criterion.
eForms.BT-541_description: A number linked to an award criterion.
eForms.BT-5421_description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a type of weight (e.g. a percentage).
eForms.BT-5422_description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a fixed value (e.g. a fixed price, a fixed cost).
eForms.BT-5423_description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a type of threshold (e.g. a minimum score, a maximum number of tenders with the highest score passing).
eForms.BT-543_description: The mathematical equation or any other description used for complicated weighing of criteria (e.g. non-linear weighing, the analytic hierarchy process) when a weighing cannot be expressed per criterion.
eForms.BT-733_description: The justification for only indicating the award criteria's order of importance, not their weighing.
eForms.BT-765_description: Whether a framework agreement with, without, or with and without the reopening of competition is involved.
eForms.BT-778_description: There is a maximum number of participants in the framework agreement.
eForms.BT-113_description: The maximum number of participants in the framework agreement.
eForms.BT-109_description: The justification for exceptional cases when the duration of framework agreements exceeds the legal limits.
eForms.BT-111_description: Any additional categories of buyers participating in the framework agreement and not mentioned by name (e.g. "all hospitals in the Tuscany region").
eForms.BT-766_description: Whether a dynamic purchasing system is involved and, in case of central purchasing bodies, whether it may be used by buyers not listed in this notice.
eForms.BT-119_description: The dynamic purchasing system is terminated. No further contracts, besides those published in this notice, will be awarded in the dynamic purchasing system. This field can be used even if no contracts are awarded in the contract award notice.
eForms.BT-123_description: The internet address of the electronic auction.
eForms.BT-122_description: Any additional information about the electronic auction.
eForms.BT-632_description: The name of the electronic tool or device used for electronic communication.
eForms.BT-724_description: Electronic communication requires the use of tools and devices that are not generally available.
eForms.BT-124_description: Electronic communication requires the use of tools and devices that are not generally available. The uniform resource locator (e.g. the web address) which gives unrestricted and full direct access to these tools and devices.
eForms.BT-127_description: The estimated date of publication of a contract notice within this procedure.
eForms.BT-631_description: The estimated date of dispatch of the invitations to confirm interest.
eForms.BT-130_description: The estimated date of dispatch of the invitations to submit tenders in two (or more) stage procedures.
eForms.BT-99_description: The description of the time limits for review procedures.
eForms.BT-15_description: The internet address for accessing (the non-restricted part of) the procurement documents. For all notices except prior information notices, the address shall give access that is direct (i.e. the exact webpage with the documents, not a general website), unrestricted (e.g. no registration), full (i.e. the procurement documents are complete) and free of charge and the documents shall be available already at the time of the publication of the notice.
eForms.BT-708_description: The language(s) in which the procurement documents are officially available. These linguistic versions are equally legally valid.
eForms.BT-737_description: The language(s) in which the procurement documents (or their parts) are unofficially available. These linguistic versions are not an official translation, they are provided only for information.
eForms.BT-14_description: The access to certain procurement documents is restricted.
eForms.BT-707_description: The justification for restricting access to certain procurement documents.
eForms.BT-615_description: The internet address with information on accessing the restricted (part of the) procurement documents.
eForms.BT-13_description: The time limit for requesting additional information about the procurement procedure.
eForms.BT-17_description: Whether economic operators are required, allowed or not allowed to submit tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest electronically.
eForms.BT-19_description: The justification for electronic submission of tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest not being possible.
eForms.BT-745_description: The description of how to submit tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest non-electronically.
eForms.BT-18_description: The internet address for submission of tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest by electronic means. The address shall be as direct as possible (ideally a dedicated address for the electronic submission, not just a general website).
eForms.BT-97_description: A language in which tenders, requests to participate, or expressions of interest may be submitted.
eForms.BT-764_description: Whether it is required, allowed or not allowed to submit (parts of) tenders as electronic catalogues.
eForms.BT-744_description: Advanced or qualified electronic signature or seal (as defined in European Parliament and Council Regulation (EU) No 910/2014) is required.
eForms.BT-63_description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit tenders which fulfil the buyer's needs differently than as proposed in the procurement documents. Further conditions for submitting variant tenders are in the procurement documents.
eForms.BT-769_description: Tenderers may submit more than one tender (for a given lot).
eForms.BT-630_description: The time limit for receipt of expressions of interest.
eForms.BT-1311_description: The time limit for receipt of requests to participate.
eForms.BT-131_description: The time limit for receipt of tenders.
eForms.BT-98_description: The period, from the tender submission deadline, for which tenders must remain valid.
eForms.BT-75_description: The description of the financial guarantee required from the tenderer when submitting a tender. The guarantee can take the form of, for example, a payment to the buyer or a document from a bank. Typically, the guarantee would be forfeit when a tenderer has won the contract but then refused to sign it.
eForms.BT-651_description: The information about subcontracting that must be indicated in the tender.
eForms.BT-132_description: The date and time for the public opening of tenders.
eForms.BT-133_description: The place (e.g. physical address, URL) where the tenders will be publicly opened.
eForms.BT-134_description: Further information about the public opening of tenders. (For example, who may participate in the opening and whether any authorisation is needed.)
eForms.BT-771_description: Whether tenderer-related information can be supplemented even after the submission deadline.
eForms.BT-772_description: Description of the tenderer-related information that can be supplemented even after the submission deadline.
eForms.BT-161_description: The value of all contracts awarded in this notice, including options and renewals.
eForms.BT-118_description: The maximum value which can be spent within the framework agreement(s) announced in this notice over its/their whole duration, in all lots, including options and renewals, as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-556_description: An identifier of a lot within the procedure that is part of a group of lots whose maximum  value is lower than the sum of maximum values of individual (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). These are maximum values as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-156_description: The maximum value which can be spent in a framework agreement within a group of lots. This information can be provided when the maximum value of a group of lots is lower than the sum of values of individual lots (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). The value covers all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals. These are maximum values as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-144_description: The reason for not choosing a winner.
eForms.BT-709_description: The maximum value which can be spent within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals, as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-660_description: The value likely to be spent within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals, as re-estimated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
eForms.BT-759_description: Number of tenders or requests to participate received. Tenders including variants or multiple tenders submitted (for one lot) by the same tenderer should be counted as one tender.
eForms.BT-760_description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received shall be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area shall also be given. All tenders shall be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender shall be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
eForms.BT-710_description: Value of the admissible tender with the lowest value. A tender shall be considered admissible where it has been submitted by a tenderer, who has not been excluded and who meets the selection criteria, and when it is in conformity with the technical specifications without being irregular (e.g. received late, having an abnormally low price or cost) or unacceptable or unsuitable. Only tenders for which it has been verified if they are admissible or inadmissible may be taken into account.
eForms.BT-711_description: Value of the admissible tender with the highest value. A tender shall be considered admissible where it has been submitted by a tenderer, who has not been excluded and who meets the selection criteria, and when it is in conformity with the technical specifications without being irregular (e.g. received late, having an abnormally low price or cost) or unacceptable or unsuitable. Only tenders for which it has been verified if they are admissible or inadmissible may be taken into account.
eForms.BT-3201_description: An identifier of a tender. The information in the tender section refers to this tender.
eForms.BT-720_description: The value of the tender or another result; including options and renewals. In case of the modification notice, the value of the modification.
eForms.BT-1711_description: The tender was ranked. (This is not the rank itself, but only whether the ranking took place).
eForms.BT-171_description: The position of the tender (i.e. whether the tender ended up first, second, third, etc.) in a design contest, a framework agreement with multiple winners (e.g. cascades), an innovation partnership, a competitive dialogue, or another procedure.
eForms.BT-162_description: The estimated revenue coming from the users of the concession (e.g. fees and fines).
eForms.BT-160_description: The estimated revenue coming from the buyer who granted the concession (e.g. prizes and payments).
eForms.BT-163_description: The description of the method used for calculating the estimated value of the concession and any other relevant information concerning the value of the concession.
eForms.BT-191_description: A country of origin of the product or the service.
eForms.BT-773_description: Whether at least a part of the contract will be subcontracted.
eForms.BT-730_description: The buyer knows at least the estimated value of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.
eForms.BT-553_description: The estimated value of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.
eForms.BT-731_description: The buyer knows at least the estimated percentage of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties compared to the whole contract.
eForms.BT-555_description: The estimated percentage of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties compared to the whole contract.
eForms.BT-554_description: The description of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.
eForms.BT-150_description: An identifier of the contract or, in case of voluntary-ex ante transparency notices and design contest result notices, of the decision. The information in the contract section refers to this contract or decision.
eForms.BT-3202_description: An identifier of the tender or another result that led to this contract.
eForms.BT-721_description: The name of the contract or, in case of voluntary-ex ante transparency notices and design contest result notices, of the decision.
eForms.BT-1451_description: The date of the official decision choosing the winning tender.
eForms.BT-145_description: The date when the contract was concluded. Typically, this is the date when the last contractual party signed the contract. However, if no contract is signed, then the date of contract conclusion may correspond to other dates (e.g. the date when the buyer notified the winning tenderer). The date of contract conclusion is always later than the end of the standstill period and the moment when any evidence submitted by the winner has been verified.
eForms.BT-768_description: The contract is awarded within a framework agreement.
eForms.BT-151_description: The uniform resource locator (e.g. the web address) of the contract.
eForms.BT-722_description: The programme of the Union funds used to at least partially finance the contract.
eForms.BT-5011_description: An identifier of the programme used to at least partially finance the contract. The most concrete information must be given (e.g. grant agreement number, national identifier, project acronym, contract number
eForms.BT-13721_description: An identifier of one or more sections within this notice. The information in the strategic procurement section refers to this section or these sections.
eForms.BT-06_description: The tender aims at reducing the environmental impacts of the procurement, fulfiling social objectives and/or buying an innovative work, supply or service.
eForms.BT-777_description: Description of the how the tender is aiming at reducing the environmental impacts of the procurement, fulfiling social objectives and/or buying an innovative work, supply or service.
eForms.BT-774_description: A process to procure goods, services and works with the aim to reduce the environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
eForms.BT-775_description: A social objective promoted by the works, supplies or services (e.g. fair working conditions).
eForms.BT-776_description: An indication that innovative works, supplies or services are being bought.
eForms.BT-715_description: The number of all vehicles (regardless of whether clean or not) falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC. These vehicles have either been purchased, leased, rented, hired-purchased or their use has been contractually committed to for the provision of a purchased service falling within the scope of the Directive 2009/33/EC.
eForms.BT-725_description: The number of zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles as defined by and falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC. These vehicles have either been purchased, leased, rented, hired-purchased or their use has been contractually committed to for the provision of a purchased service falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC.
eForms.BT-716_description: The number of clean vehicles as defined by and falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC. These vehicles have either been purchased, leased, rented, hired-purchased, or their use has been contractually committed to for the provision of a purchased service falling within the scope of Directive 2009/33/EC.
eForms.BT-754_description: The use of accessibility criteria for persons with disabilities in the technical specifications.
eForms.BT-755_description: The justification for not including accessibility criteria even though the procurement is intended for use by natural persons.
eForms.BT-712_description: The number of organisations that requested the buyer to review any of its decisions (e.g. the technical specifications, award decision).
eForms.BT-635_description: The number of requests the buyer received to review any of its decisions.
eForms.BT-636_description: The type of irregularity alleged in the review requests.
eForms.BT-726_description: The buyer emphasizes that this procurement is also suitable for small and medium enterprises (SMEs).
eForms.BT-115_description: The procurement is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA).
eForms.BT-634_description: This cancelled or unsuccessful procedure or lot will be relaunched.
eForms.BT-756_description: The prior information notice used as a call for competition (or a specific lot) is terminated. No further contracts, besides those published in this notice, will be awarded following this prior information notice used as a call for competition. This field can be used even if no contracts are awarded in the contract award notice.
eForms.BT-300_description: Any further information not mentioned in other sections of the notice.
eForms.BT-195_description: Identifier of the field that shall not be immediately published. Only fields concerning the Result value and groups of fields concerning the Tender and Procedure Lot Result can be unpublished. In the case of the  European Parliament and Council Directive 2014/25/EU, the award criteria, the procurement procedure, certain dates and in certain cases information about the nature and quantity of a service can be unpublished as well.
eForms.BT-197_description: The justification for not immediately publishing a field.
eForms.BT-196_description: The justification for not immediately publishing a field and for the choice of a later date at which it can be published.
eForms.BT-198_description: The later date at which the originally unpublished field shall be published.
eForms.Muu_description: An identifier of one or more sections within a previous notice within the procedure. The information in the modification section refers to this section or these sections.
eForms.BT-202_description: The summary of the contract modification(s).
eForms.BT-200_description: The main reason for modifying the contract.
eForms.BT-201_description: The description of the main reason for modifying the contract.
eForms.BT-13716_description: An identifier of one or more sections within the changed notice. The information in the change section refers to this section or these sections.
eForms.BT-758_description: The reference to the version of the previous notice that should be changed. This helps, for example, to keep track of versions of notices or changes to notices before publication.
eForms.BT-141_description: The description of changes in the notice compared to the original notice.
eForms.BT-719_description: The date and time when the procurement documents have changed.
eForms.BT-140_description: The main reason for the change in the notice compared to the original notice.
eForms.BT-762_description: The description of the main reason for the change in the notice compared to the original notice.
eForms.BT-05_description: The date and time when the notice has been sent for publication by the buyer.
eForms.BT-271_description: The maximum value of the framework agreement for the procurement procedure or lot, over its whole duration, including options and renewals. This value covers all contracts to be awarded within the framework agreement.
eForms.BT-1375_description: An identifier of a lot within the procedure that is part of a group of lots for which one tender can be submitted and evaluated.
eForms.BT-802_description: Additional information about the non-disclosure agreement.
eForms.BT-1118_description: The approximate value to be spent within the framework agreement(s) announced in this notice over its/their whole duration, in all lots, including options and renewals, as calculated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.

This information can be provided when the maximum or estimated value likely to be spent in of a group of lots is lower than the sum of values likely to be spent in of individual lots (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). The value covers all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals. These are values likely to be spent, as re-estimated on the basis of the winner’s tender or winners’ tenders.
