exclusionGrounds.crime-org_default: The tenderer itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for participation in a criminal organisation, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable.
exclusionGrounds.corruption_default: The tenderer itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein has been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable.
exclusionGrounds.fraud_default: The tenderer itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for fraud, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable.
exclusionGrounds.terr-offence_default: The tenderer itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein has been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for terrorist offences or offences linked to terrorist activities, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable.
exclusionGrounds.finan-laund_default: The tenderer itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein has been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for money laundering or terrorist financing, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable.
exclusionGrounds.human-traffic_default: The tenderer itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein has been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for child labour and other forms of trafficking in human beings, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable
exclusionGrounds.tax-pay_default: The tenderer has breached its obligations to pay taxes in the country of its establishment or in the country of the buyer.
exclusionGrounds.socsec-pay_default: The tenderer has breached its obligations to pay social security contributions in the country of its establishment or in the country of the buyer.
exclusionGrounds.nati-ground_default: The tenderer has breached the following obligations defined in the Finnish criminal code: violation of the right to organise, work hour offence, extortionate work discrimination, work discrimination, work safety offence or the use of unauthorised foreign labour.
exclusionGrounds.envir-law_default: The tenderer has breached its obligations in the field of environmental law.
exclusionGrounds.socsec-law_default: The tenderer has breached its obligations in the field of social law.
exclusionGrounds.labour-law_default: The tenderer has breached its obligations in the field of labour law.
exclusionGrounds.partic-confl_default: The participation of the tenderer in the procurement procedure gives rise to conflicts of interest.
exclusionGrounds.prep-confl_default: The tenderer, or any undertaking related to it, has advised the buyer or otherwise been involved in the preparation of the procurement procedure.
exclusionGrounds.sanction_default: The tenderer's previous contracts or concessions have been terminated prematurely or damages or other similar penalties have been claimed in connection with the contracts in question.
exclusionGrounds.misrepresent_default:
The tenderer is in one of the following situations. 
a) It has misrepresented information in relation to the exclusion or selection criteria,
b) It has withheld such information,
c) It has delayed to submit the supporting information required by a buyer, or
d) It has tried to influence the decision making process of the buyer, to obtain confidential information that may confer upon it undue advantages in the procurement procedure or to negligently provide misleading information that may have a material influence on decisions concerning exclusion, selection or award.
exclusionGrounds.insolvency_default: The tenderer is subject of insolvency or winding-up.
exclusionGrounds.cred-arran_default: The tenderer is in arrangement with creditors.
exclusionGrounds.bankr-nat_default: The tenderer is in any analogous situation like bankruptcy arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations.
exclusionGrounds.liq-admin_default: The assets of the tenderer are being administered by a liquidator or by the court.
exclusionGrounds.susp-act_default: The business activities of the tenderer are suspended.
exclusionGrounds.prof-misconduct_default: The tenderer is guilty of grave professional misconduct.
exclusionGrounds.distorsion_default: The tenderer has entered into agreements aimed at distorting competition.

briefly.InfoBox_tooltip: There are several identifiers associated with the procurement notice, each of which has its own meaning. The notice Hilma-number is the national notice identifier, which can be found on both national and EU notices. The TED number is the long-standing number assigned by the Publications Office of the EU to a notice, which has changed its format with the introduction of eForms to 12345678-2023. It is possible to derive the new format from the old TED number. The procurement procedure identifier is a new identifier that came with eForms and allows the identification of related notices as belonging to the same procurement procedure. The notice identifier is also new and identifies the notice in the same way as the TED number.

newProcedure.guidanceText: You have started creating a new eForms procurement procedure. All notices always belong to a procurement procedure, which is why you need to create a separate procurement procedure even for a single contract award notice. Some of the selections you make on this page will not be editable later. The type of notice is pre-selected according to the type of contract notice on the basis of which you are preparing the current contract award notice. Please read carefully the instructions on how to create an eForms procurement procedure and the texts of the info balloons on this page before clicking on the "Create procurement procedure" button at the bottom of the page.
